item.title: Mysterious 'Dinga Dinga' virus outbreak in Uganda: It causes uncontrollable shaking - India Today
item.description:
Mysterious 'Dinga Dinga' virus outbreak in Uganda: It causes uncontrollable shaking

Published On: Dec 19, 2024

Source: India Today

A mysterious illness known as 'Dinga Dinga', meaning 'shaking like dancing', has affected around 300 people in Uganda's Bundibugyo district, primarily women and girls. Symptoms include uncontrollable body shaking, fever, and severe weakness, with paralysis occurring in severe cases.

  • Affected individuals experience difficulty in walking due to uncontrollable body tremors.
  • No fatalities have been reported, but health officials stress the importance of early medical attention.
  • Treatment includes antibiotics, with most patients recovering within a week.
  • Health authorities recommend good hygiene practices to prevent spread.
  • Samples have been sent to the Health Ministry for further analysis.
“There is no scientific evidence that herbal medicine can treat this disease. We are using specific treatments, and I urge locals to seek care from district health facilities.” - Dr Kiyita Christopher

In related news, the Democratic Republic of the Congo is also dealing with an unidentified outbreak, with 394 cases and 30 fatalities reported.

item.title: What makes 'khajoor' a winter special? 5 reasons to eat dates in this season - India.com
item.description:
What makes 'khajoor' a winter special? 5 reasons to eat dates in this season

Published Date: Not specified Source: India.com

Khajoor, or dates, are often considered a winter delicacy in many cultures, particularly in regions where they are harvested during the cooler months. Here are five compelling reasons to enjoy dates during this season:

5 Benefits of Dates in Winter

  1. Nutrient-Rich Energy Boost: Dates are packed with essential nutrients, making them an excellent source of energy.
  2. Rich in Antioxidants: Dates are rich in antioxidants that help combat oxidative stress in the body.
  3. Warmth and Comfort: Traditionally used in winter recipes, dates contribute warmth and comfort.
  4. Bone Health: Dates contain minerals essential for maintaining strong bones.
  5. Natural Sweetener for Healthy Treats: Dates serve as a healthier alternative to refined sugars in festive sweets.

Khajoor is not just a delicious winter treat; it offers numerous health benefits that can enhance your seasonal diet.

item.title: TikTok Influencers Driving Raw Milk Sales – But It’s Still A Bad Idea - Men's Health UK
item.description:
TikTok Influencers are Driving Raw Milk Sales – Here’s Why It’s Still a Bad Idea

Publication Date: 2023
Source: Men's Health

With a growing interest in raw milk fueled by influencers on social media, health experts are cautioning against its consumption due to health risks. The trend gains support from public figures but is met with increasing scrutiny from nutritionists.

Key Points

  • Raw milk is trending on social media with claims of health benefits.
  • Sales of raw milk increased by up to 65% in the UK from 2023-2024.
  • Experts warn that raw milk can contain harmful bacteria leading to serious illnesses.
  • Pasteurization is a vital process that significantly reduces health risks.
  • Influencers romanticize natural diets but ignore the historical health issues associated with raw milk.
“I never recommend raw milk.” – Clare Thornton-Wood, Dietitian

In conclusion, while the allure of raw milk is rising, health professionals continue to emphasize the importance of pasteurization and the potential dangers associated with consuming unpasteurized products.

item.title: Russia Joins Malaysia, Turkey, Singapore, and Thailand, India as a Prime Medical Tourism Destination with Breakthrough Cancer Vaccine Attracting Global Travellers - Travel And Tour World
item.description:
Russia Joins Malaysia, Turkey, Singapore, and Thailand, India as a Prime Medical Tourism Destination with Breakthrough Cancer Vaccine Attracting Global Travellers

Date: Thursday, December 19, 2024

Source: Travel And Tour World

The global medical tourism industry is experiencing significant changes as Russia positions itself alongside established destinations, driven by a groundbreaking cancer vaccine that is attracting international travelers.

  • Russia is emerging as a key destination in the global medical tourism market.
  • The country has developed a groundbreaking cancer vaccine, enhancing its appeal to health-conscious travelers.
  • Medical tourists prioritize affordability, quality, and accessibility, which Russia is effectively addressing.
  • Russia's entrance diversifies the choices available to international patients alongside existing leaders like Malaysia and Turkey.
  • Efforts to enhance infrastructure and simplify travel for medical tourists are underway.
“Russia’s advancements in medical technology have gained international attention, particularly with the announcement of its cancer vaccine.”

As Russia solidifies its place in the medical tourism sector, it aims to attract travelers not only for medical treatments but also to experience its rich cultural heritage.

item.title: California Governor Declares State Of Emergency Due To Bird Flu - NDTV
item.description:
California Governor Declares State of Emergency Due to Bird Flu

Publication Date: December 13, 2024 | Source: CBS News

California Governor Gavin Newsom has declared a state of emergency in response to an outbreak of Avian influenza A (H5N1), commonly known as bird flu, which has infected 34 people in the state.

  • The declaration follows the detection of the virus in dairy cattle in Southern California.
  • No person-to-person transmission of bird flu has been identified in California.
  • A large testing and monitoring system has been implemented across the state.
  • Nationwide, 61 human cases of H5N1 have been reported since April.
  • California has distributed protective gear to dairy farms for enhanced safety.
No person-to-person transmission of bird flu has been identified in California. Most individuals infected in the state were exposed to infected cows.

The declaration underscores the urgency of enhancing monitoring and response measures to mitigate the spread of the virus amidst rising cases.

item.title: Scientists Reveal Simple Yet Effective Method To Cut Alcohol Intake - NDTV
item.description:
Scientists Reveal Simple Yet Effective Method To Cut Alcohol Intake

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Not provided

A recent study suggests that combining the warning about alcohol-related cancer risks with tracking each drink consumed is an effective way to reduce alcohol intake. This dual approach helps curb excessive drinking and promote better health.

  • The study emphasizes the cancer connection while encouraging drink-counting.
  • Excessive alcohol intake is associated with various health problems, including premature death and heart disease.
  • The lead author is Professor Simone Pettigrew from The George Institute for Global Health.
  • The study found that informing drinkers about the risks of alcohol and providing actionable steps can help reduce consumption.
  • Nearly 8,000 participants were involved in the study through three surveys.
“There are limited resources available for alcohol harm-reduction campaigns, so it's important to find out which messages resonate best,” said Professor Pettigrew.

This study offers a promising strategy for public health interventions aimed at reducing alcohol-related harm by effectively delivering critical information to the public and encouraging practical actions.

item.title: US Government Behind Bird Flu Spread? Killed Russian General's Comments Surface - Times Now
item.description:
US Government Behind Bird Flu Spread? Killed Russian General's Comments Surface

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Times Now

California Governor Gavin Newsom has declared a state of emergency due to the spread of H5N1 avian influenza, affecting dairy cows and confirmed in 16 US states, including Texas and Kansas.

  • The outbreak of bird flu has led to a state emergency declaration in California.
  • The flu has spread to dairy cows and has been confirmed across 16 states.
  • General Igor Kirillov's comments about US biological warfare have resurfaced in light of the outbreak.
  • Kirillov was killed recently, and his comments from May suggest the military's concerns about a manufactured biological crisis.
"WILL THEY DO IT AGAIN ? Louisiana and Wisconsin are reporting serious cases of Bird Flu, and California just declared a state of emergency."

There has been no response from the White House or the Department of Defense regarding the resurfaced theories linking the US government to the bird flu outbreak.

item.title: Free cancer treatment? Russia's mRNA vaccine sparks hope for a breakthrough cure - Mathrubhumi English
item.description:
Free cancer treatment? Russia's mRNA vaccine sparks hope for a breakthrough cure

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Mathrubhumi

Russia has announced the development of a groundbreaking mRNA-based vaccine designed to treat cancer, with availability expected by early 2025.

  • The personalized vaccine utilizes genetic material from a patient's tumor.
  • The cost of one dose is approximately 300,000 rubles (around USD 2,869), which the Russian government will cover.
  • Distribution details remain unclear regarding availability to Russian citizens and possible international access.
  • The vaccine is developed in collaboration with leading research centers.
  • Pre-clinical trials reportedly show promising results.
  • AI is employed to expedite the vaccine creation process.
“We are close to achieving significant milestones in cancer treatment.” – Vladimir Putin

This innovative approach promises to revolutionize cancer treatment, emphasizing a move toward personalized medicine and advanced biotechnologies.

item.title: 9 foods to improve brain health and memory - Health shots
item.description:
9 Foods to Improve Brain Health and Memory

Published: Dec 19, 2024 by Healthshots

Eating a diet rich in brain-boosting foods can enhance memory, improve cognitive function, and protect against age-related mental decline. Here are 9 foods to add to your diet.

  • Fatty Fish: Rich in omega-3 fatty acids, supports memory and mental clarity.
  • Spinach: Loaded with antioxidants, combats oxidative stress.
  • Eggs: Excellent source of choline for mood and memory support.
  • Walnuts: High in ALA and vitamin E, supports cognitive function.
  • Turmeric: Contains curcumin, boosts memory and reduces inflammation.
  • Pumpkin Seeds: Good source of magnesium and iron, essential for neurotransmitter function.
  • Broccoli: Full of antioxidants and vitamin K, protects brain cells.
  • Dark Chocolate: Rich in flavonoids, enhances mood and memory.
  • Blueberries: Packed with flavonoids, improve neuron communication.

item.title: Health, skin and fitness tips to embrace before entering 2025 - The Indian Express
item.description:
Health, Skin, and Fitness Tips to Embrace Before Entering 2025

Publication Date: December 19, 2024 Source: The Indian Express

This article provides essential health, skin, and fitness tips for individuals preparing for the new year. It emphasizes the importance of balanced nutrition, hydration, skincare, and lifestyle choices.

  • Healthy carbohydrates should be consumed in moderation for energy and brain function.
  • Hydration needs vary; the "eight glasses a day" rule is not one-size-fits-all.
  • Effective skincare depends on compatibility with individual skin types rather than price.
  • Quitting smoking is crucial for lung health and to avoid nicotine addiction.
  • Small, balanced meals help maintain metabolism and prevent binge eating.
  • Severe glucose spikes may indicate health issues like insulin resistance.
  • Strength training is important for overall fitness and does not lead to bulkiness in women.
  • Raw vegetable juices can cause health problems compared to whole, cooked vegetables.
  • Moderation in fat intake is necessary to prevent weight gain and cardiovascular problems.
  • Seed oils are not inherently harmful; a diverse range of fats is needed for a healthy diet.
"Quitting smoking is the healthiest option because both smoking and vaping damage the lungs and lead to nicotine addiction."

This guidance aims to enhance well-being as we approach 2025, focusing on practical and balanced approaches to health.

item.title: Many Factors Distort Blood Pressure Reading: Study - The Sentinel Assam
item.description:
Many Factors Distort Blood Pressure Reading: Study

Date: Not specified, Source: Xinhua news agency

More often than not, patients and even nurses and doctors are skipping steps that help paint an accurate portrait of someone’s blood pressure, leading to readings that may be misleading.

  • Correct positioning during blood pressure measurement is essential for accuracy.
  • Guidelines recommend sitting properly and avoiding distractions during the reading.
  • Recent research suggests that increasing physical activity can help lower blood pressure.
  • Replacing sedentary behavior with exercise can lead to significant health benefits.
  • Approximately 1.28 billion adults worldwide suffer from hypertension, with many unaware of their condition.
“High blood pressure is one of the biggest health issues globally... there may be accessible ways to tackle the problem in addition to medication.” - Emmanuel Stamatakis

Taking proper blood pressure readings is crucial for preventing serious health issues, and small changes in physical activity can have a significant impact on cardiovascular health.

item.title: Lifestyle News Live Today December 19, 2024: Woman who lost 7 kg, made 'belly fat disappear' shares 8 things that happen with low sugar intake: Automatic weight loss - Hindustan Times
item.description:
The Secret Behind Sobhita Dhulipala's Gorgeous Jet-Black Hair Revealed

Date: December 19, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Sobhita Dhulipala shared the traditional ritual behind her luxurious jet-black hair in a recent interview, highlighting a common practice that many follow.

  • Sobhita revealed the secret behind her hair in an interview.
  • It involves a traditional ritual common among many people.
Sobhita stated, 'It's a tradition we have all followed.'

This insight into Sobhita's beauty routine not only sheds light on her hair care but also connects to cultural practices that many can relate to.

item.title: Woman who lost 7 kg, made 'belly fat disappear' shares 8 things that happen with low sugar intake: Automatic weight loss - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Woman who lost 7 kg, made 'belly fat disappear' shares 8 things that happen with low sugar intake: Automatic weight loss

Date: Dec 19, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Reducing refined sugar intake can lead to significant changes in health, mood, and physique. Leana documented her personal journey of losing 7 kg, highlighting the changes that come with cutting sugar.

  • Less mood swings
  • Less acne
  • More energy
  • More defined face
  • Less puffy face
  • Automatic weight loss
  • Less bloating
  • Minimized dark circles
“Refined sugar is highly problematic because it’s addictive: the more you consume, the more you crave.”

Leana emphasizes the importance of replacing refined sugars with natural options for effortless weight loss.

item.title: 5 reasons vaping is injurious to health - Mint
item.description:
5 Reasons Vaping is Injurious to Health

Publication Date: December 18, 2024   Source: Mint

Vaping, initially seen as safer than cigarettes, poses health risks due to inhaling nicotine and chemicals, threatening well-being despite its perceived lesser harm.

  • Nicotine addiction alters brain chemistry affecting mood, learning, and memory in adolescents.
  • Harmful chemicals lead to respiratory issues like coughing, wheezing, and shortness of breath.
  • Nicotine increases heart rate and blood pressure, raising heart attack and stroke risks.
  • Cancer-causing chemicals may be present, increasing lung cancer risk with long-term exposure.
  • Disruption of brain development affects cognitive function, memory, and learning abilities.
“Vaping introduces addictive nicotine, altering brain chemistry and affecting mood, learning, and memory in adolescents.”

Vaping represents a significant health risk, particularly among youth, as its long-term effects are not yet fully understood but could lead to serious health issues.

item.title: Deaths from diarrhoeal diseases drop globally: Study - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Deaths from Diarrhoeal Diseases Drop Globally: Study

Publication Date: Wednesday, December 19, 2024   Source: Lancet Infectious Diseases

The study published in the Lancet Infectious Diseases indicates a nearly 60% decrease in global deaths from diarrhoeal diseases, while emphasizing that children and the elderly remain the most affected demographics, particularly in sub-Saharan Africa and South Asia.

  • In 2021, diarrhoeal diseases led to 1.2 million deaths compared to 2.9 million in 1990.
  • Children under five years saw a remarkable 79% decline in mortality rates.
  • Regions with high-income countries reported less than one death per 100,000 children under five.
  • South Asia experienced the highest mortality rates among those aged 70 and older, with 476 deaths per 100,000.
  • Diarrhoeal mortality rates reflected overall declines across age groups globally.
  • The researchers found that disability-adjusted life years (DALYs) shrank from 186 million in 1990 to 59 million in 2021.
"In spite of the encouraging progress made combating diarrhoeal mortality, a multipronged approach is required to simultaneously tackle live-saving solutions while also prioritising preventive interventions to alleviate burdens on health systems." - Dr. Hmwe Hmwe Kyu

The findings underline the need for continued efforts in healthcare interventions to combat diarrheal diseases, particularly focusing on preventive measures and targeted vaccine developments.

item.title: California declares emergency to combat rising bird flu infection in dairy - The Times of India
item.description:
California Declares Emergency to Address Rising Bird Flu in Dairy Sector

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: California Health Department

California has declared an emergency to combat an outbreak of bird flu that is affecting the dairy industry, leading to significant concerns for animal health and economic stability.

  • The emergency declaration allows for expedited resources and actions to address the outbreak.
  • Farmers are being advised on biosecurity measures to contain the spread of the virus.
  • The flu strain has been reported to cause fatalities in infected birds.
  • Poultry and dairy farms in multiple counties are currently under monitoring.
"We are taking immediate steps to protect our livestock and ensure the safety of our food supply," said a spokesperson from the California Health Department.

This emergency response aims to mitigate the effects of the influenza outbreak on both animal populations and the broader agricultural sector.

item.title: How high BP patients found their real triggers: Kidney blockage, sleep apnea among unknown risks - The Indian Express
item.description:
How high BP patients found their real triggers: Kidney blockage, sleep apnea among unknown risks

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Indian Express

This article discusses resistant hypertension, detailing two case studies of patients who struggled with high blood pressure despite medication. It highlights the importance of identifying secondary causes to effectively manage and treat the condition.

  • Resistant hypertension affects 20% of patients globally.
  • Case studies revealed underlying conditions like renal artery stenosis and sleep apnea as triggers.
  • Regular monitoring of blood pressure is crucial, especially for those with co-morbidities.
  • Identifying and addressing secondary causes of hypertension can lead to normalization of blood pressure.
“The point is other than known co-morbidities, there are other triggers for BP…”

In conclusion, understanding and identifying the real triggers of resistant hypertension can substantially improve patient outcomes by tailoring effective treatment strategies.

item.title: 12-month diagnosed prevalent cases of severe asthma to reach 1.89 million in 2033 - The Financial Express
item.description:
12-month diagnosed prevalent cases of severe asthma to reach 1.89 million in 2033

Date: October 2023 Source: Financial Express

The article discusses the projected increase in diagnosed severe asthma cases due to population growth and low mortality rates associated with the disease. GlobalData forecasts a rise from 1.81 million cases in 2023 to 1.89 million in 2033.

  • The annual growth rate for 12-month diagnosed cases of severe asthma is estimated at 0.49%.
  • Lifetime diagnosed cases are projected to rise from 3.29 million in 2023 to 3.39 million in 2033 at a rate of 0.30% per year.
  • The US is expected to have the highest number of cases, while Japan will have the lowest.
Molly Moran, Senior Epidemiologist at GlobalData, states: "The main reason for the expected increase in the 12-month and lifetime diagnosed prevalent cases of severe asthma is population growth and relatively low mortality associated with asthma."

The article emphasizes the importance of addressing the prevalence and management of severe asthma, particularly in light of increasing population dynamics.

item.title: Russia To Launch Cancer Vaccines By 2025 For Free Of Cost: Report - ABP Live
item.description:
Russia To Launch Cancer Vaccines By 2025 For Free Of Cost: Report

Published on: Not specified   Source: TASS News Agency

Russia has claimed to have developed its own mRNA vaccine against cancer, which it plans to launch for the general public in early 2025, reported TASS news agency. The vaccine will be distributed free of cost to patients, General Director of the Radiology Medical Research Center of the Russian Ministry of Health Andrey Kaprin has told Radio Rossiya.

  • The vaccine's pre-clinical trials have shown that it suppresses tumor development and potential metastases.
  • Russian President Vladimir Putin mentioned the progress on cancer vaccines that could soon be available to patients.
  • Specific types of cancer targeted by the vaccine have yet to be disclosed.
  • Other countries and firms are also working on cancer vaccine developments, with various collaborations underway.
"We have come very close to the creation of so-called cancer vaccines and immunomodulatory drugs of a new generation," said Vladimir Putin.

This initiative demonstrates Russia's commitment to advancing cancer treatment. However, it remains to be seen how effective the vaccine will be once launched and the specific cancers it aims to address.

item.title: 5 tips to keep your heart safe and strong this winter - Mint
item.description:
5 Tips to Keep Your Heart Safe and Strong This Winter

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Brown Health University

Indulgence in comfort foods, physical inactivity and letting healthy habits slip during the colder months negatively impact heart health. However, incorporating some simple tips can help maintain heart health throughout the winter season.

  • Be mindful of comfort food indulgence.
  • Stay physically active despite the cold.
  • Maintain healthy habits during winter.
  • Consider heart-healthy nutrition.
  • Monitor heart health regularly.
“Indulgence in comfort foods, physical inactivity and letting healthy habits slip during the colder months negatively impact heart health.”

Maintaining heart health is crucial, especially during the winter months when habits can change due to the weather.
